issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: euare-servercertupload should not require a certificate chain

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: the file option supposed to read the file, but right now it just sends the file name to the server.

comments.body: [~gholms] In addition I think we should make the <certificate-chain> as optional parameter.
This is fixed in commit {{2a60687}}.  I opened TOOLS-452 for handling [~spark]'s request to make the chain optional.

Latest Output:
{code}
[root@g-26-05 cert]# euare-servercertupload -s mycert2.pem --certificate-file cacert.pem --private-key-file mykey.pem --certificate-chain-file cacert.pem --debug
